text: Maurice A. Ferré (June 23, 1935 - September 19, 2019) was an American politician. He was a six-term Mayor of Miami, from 1973 through 1985. Ferré was the first Puerto Rican-born United States mayor and the first Hispanic Mayor of Miami.The Ferre Family: Puerto Rican by Birth, Yanqui in Spirit He was an unsuccessful candidate in the 2010 elections for the U.S. Senate seat for Florida vacated by Mel Martínez for the Democratic primary. Ferré died on September 19, 2019 at a Miami hospital from spinal cancer at the age of 84.Former mayor Maurice Ferré, considered the father of modern-day Miami, is dead ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from spinal cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Florida Category:Mayors of Miami Category:Puerto Rican politicians Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Ponce, Puerto Rico
title: Maurice Ferré
